Steps to reproduce
------------------

The ConnectionURI passed to New-PSSession sometimes redirects to another URI. This was handled in for Linux in https://github.com/PowerShell/psl-omi-provider/issues/72. However, this does not seem to work when a token is used instead.

```powershell
> $Session = New-PSSession -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -ConnectionUri "https://ps.compliance.protection.outlook.com/PowerShell-LiveId?BasicAuthToOAuthConversion=true" -Credential $Ctoken -Authentication Basic -AllowRedirection

New-PSSession : [ps.compliance.protection.outlook.com] Connecting to remote server
ps.compliance.protection.outlook.com failed with the following error message :
Basic Authorization failed for user ***@***.com For more information, see the about_Remote_Troubleshooting Help topic.
At line:1 char:12
+ $Session = New-PSSession -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -Conne ...
+            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : OpenError: (System.Manageme....RemoteRunspace:RemoteRunspace) [New-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : 2,PSSessionOpenFailed
```

In this case, the redirect would have been to `https://nam04b.ps.compliance.protection.outlook.com/PowerShell-LiveId?BasicAuthToOAuthConversion=true`

Expected behavior
-----------------

The connection should proceed to `https://nam04b.ps.compliance.protection.outlook.com/PowerShell-LiveId?BasicAuthToOAuthConversion=true`

The following warning should be displayed:

```
WARNING: Your connection has been redirected to the following URI:
"https://nam04b.ps.compliance.protection.outlook.com/PowerShell-LiveId?BasicAuthToOAuthConversion=true;PSVersion=6.1.0"
```

Actual behavior
---------------

The connection does not succeed.

I made the following observations:
* Connecting directly to `https://nam04b.ps.compliance.protection.outlook.com/PowerShell-LiveId?BasicAuthToOAuthConversion=true` works fine with both an OAuth token as well as username/password auth.
* Connecting via username/password basic auth instead of a token redirects fine with or without the query parameters, and includes the query parameters in the redirect.
* At a network level, the error occurs before the connection to the redirected URL is ever attempted. The expected warning does not show up either.
* Capturing the HTTP packet sent by New-PSSession and sending it manually shows that the 
ps.compliance.protection.outlook.com server correctly responds with the redirect. mitmproxy shows the HTTP response was correctly received as well. I'm not sure why the error claims that "Basic Authorization failed" though.

Perhaps the header is too large and that messes up the redirect logic somehow? The Authorization header is "Basic ...<2300 characters here>..." when an OAuth token is used.

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

Tested with the latest nightly build for Linux

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.10729
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.1.0-preview.10729
OS                             Linux 3.13.0-24-generic #47-Ubuntu SMP Fri May 2 23:30:00 UTC 2014
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
